intro: Scrophularia hemschinica, commonly known as the Hemschínica figwort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant features erect stems that are often hairy, with opposite, ovate leaves that have serrated edges. Its flowers are tubular and usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Scrophularia hemschinica is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value in some species.
